poem:
Title: "Maxima in Suspension"

Once a grace of flight in zenith
Now earthbound,
Halted by concerns of mortality.
The Max 9, silenced in steel repose,

No strokes across the Northern skies,
No whispers through Alaskan pine.
Imprisoned till the seal of safety 
is assured by time.

Lo, the timeline undefined,
Yet in this calm, an echo:
Life's brevity,
conjured by cold machinery.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Pete Buttigieg said he was “not putting a timeline” on when the FAA will allow the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
